intro: Matelea diademata, commonly known as the silverleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically broad and covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it a distinctive appearance. Matelea diademata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
